description.value: Value Set for Flag Category (Example). This value set defines category codes for Patient Record Flags. Patient record flags is a mechanism in which an alert can be assigned to patients who have certain high risk clinical needs or behavior problems. Flags can be configured to appear during the patient look-up process.

definition.value: Patient has special needs, limitations, or preferences that impact clinical treatment.

Patient actions that pose risk or otherwise impact health or treatement, e.g. verbal threats, possession of weapons in a health care facility, acts of violence, history of suicidal behavior, drug-seeking behavior, or sexual harrassment.
Patient is a participant in a research study.
Special circumstances in terms of transportation, living situation, or communications.
Special issues with respect to payment, insurance, or other administrative matters.
Flag or alert not belonging to any other category.
